title: September: FEC Compliance & Scenarios
description: Practice federal campaign compliance while managing late-campaign challenges.

tasks.prompt: FEC Filing Quiz: Complete a simulated Form 3 quarterly report.

questions.question: Which form is required for quarterly reporting of contributions and expenditures?

tasks.prompt: Community Canvassing: A retired voter says, 'I retired with $1.5M. I’m worried it won’t last. What would you do for people like me?' Respond as a candidate.
Constitution Day Challenge: Protesters at Armadillo University confront you about your prior Gaza petition decision. Write a response balancing principle and messaging.
Postcard Offer: Choose how to allocate resources for postcards and ads.

questions.question: Which postcard/ad option do you choose?
options: 75 CC → postcards + late Oct ads only

tasks.prompt: Debate Challenge: Decide how to handle an October debate invitation.

questions.question: Choose your debate strategy
options: Hire a debate coach (50 CC add-on)

narrator: By September, quarterly FEC reporting (Form 3) is due. You will also face campaign scenarios such as Constitution Day outreach, postcard mailers, and debate invitations.
readingSummary: Quarterly FEC reporting ensures compliance with campaign finance law.
September scenarios simulate late-campaign pressures and strategic decision-making.
Choices affect Candidate Coins (CC), voter approval, and campaign credibility.
